sub_causes: Failure to enforce the mandatory 4-hour pre-heating duration
Lack of operational supervision during plant startup/cold conditions
Man.evidence: Confirmed Root Cause states a failure in operational governance to enforce pre-heating.

Man.cause: Inadequate maintenance oversight of safety interlocks
sub_causes: Failure to verify SL 7m (RAV/Ash system interlock) during routine checks
Man.evidence: Root Cause identifies a systemic gap in routine verification of safety interlocks.

Machine.cause: Mechanical obstruction of the Rotary Air Preheater (RAV)
sub_causes: Torque-related stall due to clumped ash accumulation
Potential RAV thermal overload relay trip
Machine.evidence: Root Cause cites a torque-related obstruction; Doc 6 mentions thermal overload relay trips for RAVs.

sub_causes: Heater element failure leading to localized cold spots
Insufficient heat transfer to maintain ash temperature above dew point
Machine.evidence: Root Cause identifies a deficiency in the PM strategy for hopper heaters.

sub_causes: Ash reached acid dew point resulting in sticky/clumped consistency
Increased moisture content leading to bridging between discharge electrodes
Material.evidence: Root Cause states ash reached acid dew point and clumped; Expert Finding notes ash bridging.

sub_causes: Inadequate inspection intervals for hopper heater integrity
Lack of standardized interlock testing procedures for SL 7 series
Method.evidence: Confirmed Root Cause identifies deficiency in PM strategy and interlock verification.

sub_causes: RAV operation failure not immediately triggering upstream alarms
Failure in ash handling control logic / Interlock 7m
Method.evidence: Electrical Expert Findings point to failure in ash handling control logic (Interlock 7m).

Measurement.cause: Interlock signal/logic failure for ash level monitoring
sub_causes: Delayed triggering of the High-High threshold trip (Interlock 7e)
ZSS (Zero Speed Switch) micro-switch time delay issues
Measurement.evidence: Expert Finding 2 and Doc 6 (item j) reference level thresholds and ZSS time delays.

sub_causes: Rapid cooling of hopper walls during startup phase
Inadequate insulation performance contributing to acid dew point transition
Environment.evidence: Inferred from the requirement for a 4-hour pre-heating protocol to maintain ash flowability.

root_cause_confirmed: The systemic root cause is a deficiency in the preventive maintenance strategy for hopper heaters and a failure in operational governance to enforce the mandatory four-hour pre-heating protocol. This allowed ash to reach the acid dew point and clump, creating a torque-related obstruction in the RAV. The heating system is critical for ensuring ash flowability to prevent motor overload. A systemic gap in the routine verification of safety interlocks (SL 7m) also contributed.
